trans-unit.source: A file named index.html, which is the root page for the website
trans-unit.target: 名为 index.html 的文件，这是网站的根页面

trans-unit.source: A file that contains all directories in the package which contain program binaries. The directories are separated with the target platform’s path separator character (i.e. either : or ;).
trans-unit.target: 包含程序包中所有包含程序二进制文件的所有目录的文件。目录用目标平台的路径分隔符分隔（即 : 或 ; ）。

trans-unit.source: A file that contains all directories that need to be prepended to an environment’s $PATH before a program in this package can be expected to run correctly. The order of the elements are precise and meaningful so should not be altered. This file is used in concert with RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT to compute the full set of environment variables that should be added to an environment before running a program in this package.
trans-unit.target: 一个包含所有目录的文件，在此程序包中的程序可以正常运行之前，该目录需要在环境的 $PATH 之前添加。元素的顺序是精确且有意义的，因此不应更改。该文件与 RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT 一起使用，以计算在运行此程序包中的程序之前应添加到环境中的完整环境变量集。

trans-unit.source: A file that contains similar information as the RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT file, but is constructed from a package’s build-time dependencies instead of its runtime dependencies. This file is not currently consumed by any other software in the Chef Habitat ecosystem, but can be used for troubleshooting and informative purposes.
trans-unit.target: 包含与RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT文件类似的信息的文件，但该文件是根据程序包的构建时依赖性而不是其运行时依赖性构造的。目前，Chef Habitat生态系统中的任何其他软件均不使用此文件，但可以将其用于故障排除和提供信息的目的。

trans-unit.source: A file that provides information on which specific dependencies have influenced the final value of a given variable in the BUILDTIME_ENVIRONMENT file. This file is not currently consumed by any other software in the Chef Habitat ecosystem, but can be used for troubleshooting and informative purposes.
trans-unit.target: 一个文件,它提供了关于哪些特定的依赖关系影响了BUILDTIME_ENVIRONMENT文件中给定变量的最终值的信息。这个文件目前不被Chef Habitat生态系统中的任何其他软件所消耗,但可以用于故障排除和提供信息的目的。

trans-unit.source: A file that provides information on which specific dependencies have influenced the final value of a given variable in the RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT file. This file is not currently consumed by any other software in the Chef Habitat ecosystem, but can be used for troubleshooting and informative purposes.
trans-unit.target: 一个文件,它提供了哪些特定的依赖关系影响了RUNTIME_ENVIRONMENT文件中给定变量的最终值的信息。这个文件目前不被Chef Habitat生态系统中的任何其他软件所消耗,但可以用于故障排除和提供信息的目的。

trans-unit.source: A filter may specify an attribute:
trans-unit.target: 一个过滤器可以指定一个属性。

trans-unit.source: A filter statement may use method call syntax (which allows basic criteria operations, such as equality, regex matching, and ruby === comparison) or block syntax (which allows arbitrary code).
trans-unit.target: 过滤器语句可以使用方法调用语法（允许基本条件操作，例如相等性，正则表达式匹配和ruby === 比较）或块语法（允许任意代码）。

trans-unit.source: A filter that identifies a time series that should be used as the denominator of a ratio that will be compared with the threshold. If a denominator_filter is specified, the time series specified by the filter field will be used as the numerator.The filter is similar to the one that is specified in the MetricService.ListTimeSeries request (that call is useful to verify the time series that will be retrieved / processed) and must specify the metric type and optionally may contain restrictions on resource type, resource labels, and metric labels. This field may not exceed 2048 Unicode characters in length.
trans-unit.target: 一个过滤器,用于确定一个时间序列,该时间序列应被用作与阈值进行比较的比率的分母。如果指定了分母_过滤器,过滤器字段指定的时间序列将被用作分子。过滤器类似于在MetricService.ListTimeSeries请求中指定的过滤器(该调用对于验证将被检索/处理的时间序列很有用),必须指定度量类型,并且可以选择包含对资源类型、资源标签和度量标签的限制。这个字段的长度不能超过2048个Unicode字符。

trans-unit.source: A filter that identifies which time series should be compared with the threshold.The filter is similar to the one that is specified in the MetricService.ListTimeSeries request (that call is useful to verify the time series that will be retrieved / processed) and must specify the metric type and optionally may contain restrictions on resource type, resource labels, and metric labels. This field may not exceed 2048 Unicode characters in length.
trans-unit.target: 一个过滤器,用于确定哪些时间序列应与阈值进行比较.该过滤器与MetricService.ListTimeSeries请求中指定的过滤器类似(该调用对于验证将被检索/处理的时间序列很有用),必须指定度量类型,并可选择包含对资源类型、资源标签和度量标签的限制。这个字段的长度不能超过2048个Unicode字符。

trans-unit.target: 允许从结果中排除订阅的 filter: 'children.childType ne Subscription' （即过滤器：'children.childType ne Subscription'）

trans-unit.source: A good visual code editor is not a requirement for working with Chef Infra, but a good code editor can save you time. A code editor should support the following: themes, plugins, snippets, syntax Ruby code coloring/highlighting, multiple cursors, a tree view of the entire folder/repository you are working with, and a Git integration.

trans-unit.source: A guard property can be used to evaluate the state of a node during the execution phase of a Chef Infra Client run. Based on the results of this evaluation, a guard property is then used to tell Chef Infra Client if it should continue executing a resource. A guard property accepts either a string value or a Ruby block value:
trans-unit.target: 在Chef Infra Client运行的执行阶段,警卫属性可以用来评估节点的状态。基于此评估结果,guard 属性可用于告诉 Chef Infra Client 是否应继续执行资源。guard属性可以接受字符串值或Ruby块值。

trans-unit.source: A guard property can be used to evaluate the state of a node during the execution phase of the chef-client run. Based on the results of this evaluation, a guard property is then used to tell the chef-client if it should continue executing a resource. A guard property accepts either a string value or a Ruby block value:
trans-unit.target: 在chef-client运行的执行阶段,guard属性可以用来评估节点的状态。基于这个评估的结果,guard 属性被用来告诉 chef-client 是否应该继续执行资源。guard属性可以接受一个字符串值或Ruby块值。

trans-unit.source: A guard property is useful for ensuring that a resource is idempotent by allowing that resource to test for the desired state as it is being executed, and then if the desired state is present, for Chef Infra Client to do nothing.
trans-unit.target: 守护属性对于确保资源是幂等的很有用,它允许该资源在执行时测试所需的状态,然后如果所需的状态存在,对于Chef Infra Client来说什么都不做。

trans-unit.source: A guard property is useful for ensuring that a resource is idempotent by allowing that resource to test for the desired state as it is being executed, and then if the desired state is present, for the chef-client to do nothing.
trans-unit.target: guard属性对于确保一个资源是幂等的很有用,它允许该资源在执行时测试所需的状态,然后如果所需的状态存在,则厨师客户端什么也不做。

trans-unit.source: A hard link is a directory entry that associates a file with another file in the same file system. In other words, “multiple directory entries to the same file.” A hard link creates a new file that points to the same inode as the original file.
trans-unit.target: 硬链接是一个目录条目，它将一个文件与同一文件系统中的另一个文件相关联。换句话说，“同一目录中有多个目录条目。” 硬链接会创建一个新文件，该文件指向与原始文件相同的索引节点。

trans-unit.source: A hard link is a directory entry that associates a file with another file in the same file system. In other words, “multiple directory entries to the same file.” A hard link creates a new file that points to the same inode as the original file. On Windows, this resource can be used to create directory junction/reparse points.
trans-unit.target: 硬链接是一个目录条目，它将一个文件与同一文件系统中的另一个文件相关联。换句话说，“同一目录中有多个目录条目。” 硬链接将创建一个新文件，该文件指向与原始文件相同的索引节点。在Windows上，此资源可用于创建目录连接/解析点。

trans-unit.source: A heartbeat message is used to let all of the nodes in an organization know that the Chef Push Jobs server is available. The Chef Push Jobs server listens for heartbeat messages from each Chef Push Jobs client. If there is no heartbeat from a Chef Push Jobs client, the Chef Push Jobs server will mark that node as unavailable for job messages until the heartbeat resumes.
trans-unit.target: 心跳消息用于让组织中的所有节点知道 Chef Push Jobs 服务器可用。Chef Push Jobs 服务器会监听来自每个 Chef Push Jobs 客户端的心跳消息。如果没有来自Chef Push Jobs客户端的心跳,Chef Push Jobs服务器将把该节点标记为不可用,直到心跳恢复。

trans-unit.source: A key thing to remember is that dependencies impact two or more projects. Those projects have their own pipelines up through Acceptance, but when a project’s tests are run in the shared Union, Rehearsal, and Delivered pipeline for the organization, tests for all projects which depend on the currently-tested project will also run as part of the Union stage. This is to ensure that no cross-project bugs were introduced, such as a breaking API change. Also, you should still run smoke and functional tests on a project that depends on other project(s) during the Acceptance stage (because you know what those dependencies are); however, you may not know which projects depend on your project. Chef Automate uses the Union stage to runs tests against projects that depend on your project.
trans-unit.target: 要记住的关键是依赖关系会影响两个或多个项目。这些项目通过验收拥有自己的管道，但是当在组织的共享联合，排练和交付管道中运行项目的测试时，依赖于当前测试项目的所有项目的测试也将作为项目的一部分运行。联盟舞台。这是为了确保不会引入跨项目的错误，例如重大的API更改。另外，在接受阶段，您仍然应该对依赖于其他项目的项目进行冒烟和功能测试（因为您知道这些依赖关系是什么）；但是，您可能不知道哪些项目取决于您的项目。 Chef Automate使用Union阶段对依赖于您的项目的项目运行测试。

A knife plugin is installed to the ~/.chef/plugins/knife/ directory, from where it can be run just like any other knife subcommand.

trans-unit.source: A library allows arbitrary Ruby code to be included in a cookbook, either as a way of extending the classes that are built-in to the chef-client—Chef::Recipe, for example—or for implementing entirely new functionality, similar to a mixin in Ruby. A library file is a Ruby file that is located within a cookbook’s /libraries directory. Because a library is built using Ruby, anything that can be done with Ruby can be done in a library file.
trans-unit.target: 库允许将任意Ruby代码包含在食谱中，既可以作为扩展内置于 Chef::Recipe 客户端（例如Chef :: Recipe）中的类的方式，也可以用于实现全新的功能，类似于Ruby中的mixin。库文件是位于食谱的 /libraries 目录中的Ruby文件。由于库是使用Ruby构建的，因此可以在库文件中完成Ruby可以完成的所有操作。

trans-unit.source: A library allows arbitrary Ruby code to be included in a cookbook. The most common use for libraries is to write helpers that are used throughout recipes and custom resources. A library file is a Ruby file that is located within a cookbook’s /libraries directory. Because a library is built using Ruby, anything that can be done with Ruby can be done in a library file, including advanced functionality such as extending built-in Chef classes.
trans-unit.target: 库允许将任意Ruby代码包含在食谱中。库的最常见用法是编写在整个配方和自定义资源中使用的助手。库文件是位于食谱的 /libraries 目录中的Ruby文件。因为库是使用Ruby构建的，所以可以使用Ruby完成的所有操作都可以在库文件中完成，包括扩展内置Chef类之类的高级功能。

trans-unit.source: A list of AccessLevel resource names that allow resources within the ServicePerimeter to be accessed from the internet. AccessLevels listed must be in the same policy as this ServicePerimeter. Referencing a nonexistent AccessLevel is a syntax error. If no AccessLevel names are listed, resources within the perimeter can only be accessed via GCP calls with request origins within the perimeter. For Service Perimeter Bridge, must be empty. Format: accessPolicies/{policy_id}/accessLevels/{access_level_name}
trans-unit.target: 允许从互联网访问ServicePerimeter内的资源的AccessLevel资源名称列表。所列出的AccessLevels必须和这个ServicePerimeter在同一个策略中。引用一个不存在的AccessLevel是一个语法错误。如果没有列出AccessLevel名称,则只能通过请求起源于周界内的GCP调用来访问周界内的资源。对于服务周界桥,必须为空。格式:accessPolicies/{policy_id}/accessLevels/{access_level_name}。

trans-unit.source: A list of IDs of GCP regions where messages that are published to the topic may be persisted in storage. An empty list means that no regions are allowed, and is not a valid configuration.

trans-unit.source: A list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

trans-unit.source: A list of arguments that will be presented to the step when it is started. If the image does not define an entrypoint, the first element in args is used as the entrypoint, and the remainder will be used as arguments.
trans-unit.target: 在启动步骤时将显示给该步骤的参数列表。如果用于运行步骤容器的映像具有入口点，则将args用作该入口点的参数。如果图像未定义入口点，则args中的第一个元素将用作入口点，其余部分将用作参数。

trans-unit.source: A list of authorized addresses from which other backend nodes can connect to perform streaming replication. samehost and samenet are special symbols to allow connections from the this node’s IP address and its subnet. You may also use all to match any IP address. You may specify a hostname or IP address in CIDR format (172.20.143.89/32 for a single host, or 172.20.143.0/24 for a small network. See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.5/static/auth-pg-hba-conf.html for alternative formats.

trans-unit.target: 每个键值对对应于EC2实例标签的哈希列表，例如 [{:key=>"Name", :value=>"Testing Box"}, {:key=>"Environment", :value=>"Dev"}]

trans-unit.source: A list of header names for headers that need to be removed from the request prior to forwarding the request to the backendService.

trans-unit.source: A list of properties that controls how Chef Infra Client is to attempt to manage a service: :restart, :reload, :status. For :restart, the init script or other service provider can use a restart command; if :restart is not specified, Chef Infra Client attempts to stop and then start a service. For :reload, the init script or other service provider can use a reload command. For :status, the init script or other service provider can use a status command to determine if the service is running; if :status is not specified, Chef Infra Client attempts to match the service_name against the process table as a regular expression, unless a pattern is specified as a parameter property. Default value: { restart: false, reload: false, status: false } for all platforms (except for the Red Hat platform family, which defaults to { restart: false, reload: false, status: true }.)
trans-unit.target: 属性列表，用于控制Chef Infra Client如何尝试管理服务 :restart ， :reload 和 :status 。对于 :restart ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用重新启动命令；如果未指定 :restart ，Chef Infra Client将尝试停止然后再启动服务。对于 :reload ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用reload命令。对于 :status ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用状态命令来确定服务是否正在运行；如果未指定 :status ，则Chef Infra Client尝试匹配 service_name 除非将模式指定为参数属性，否则不要将过程表作为正则表达式。对于所有平台 { restart: false, reload: false, status: false } 默认值：{重新启动：false，重新加载：false，状态：false}（Red Hat平台系列除外，其默认值为 { restart: false, reload: false, status: true } 。）

trans-unit.source: A list of properties that controls how the chef-client is to attempt to manage a service: :restart, :reload, :status. For :restart, the init script or other service provider can use a restart command; if :restart is not specified, the chef-client attempts to stop and then start a service. For :reload, the init script or other service provider can use a reload command. For :status, the init script or other service provider can use a status command to determine if the service is running; if :status is not specified, the chef-client attempts to match the service_name against the process table as a regular expression, unless a pattern is specified as a parameter property. Default value: { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => false } for all platforms (except for the Red Hat platform family, which defaults to { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => true }.)
trans-unit.target: 控制厨师客户端如何尝试管理服务的属性列表 :restart ， :reload 和 :status 。对于 :restart ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供商可以使用重新启动命令；如果未指定 :restart ，则厨师客户端尝试停止然后再启动服务。对于 :reload ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用reload命令。对于 :status ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用状态命令来确定服务是否正在运行；如果未指定 :status ，则厨师客户端尝试匹配 service_name 除非将模式指定为参数属性，否则不要将过程表作为正则表达式。所有平台的默认值： { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => false } （Red Hat平台系列除外，其默认值为 { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => true } 。）

trans-unit.source: A list of public visible licenses that apply to this snapshot. This can be because the original image had licenses attached (such as a Windows image). snapshotEncryptionKey nested object Encrypts the snapshot using a customer-supplied encryption key.

trans-unit.source: A local directory to use for temporary files when creating a backup archive. trans-unit.source: A loop statement is used to execute a block of code one (or more) times. A loop statement is created when .each is added to an expression that defines an array or a hash. An array is an integer-indexed collection of objects. Each element in an array can be associated with and referred to by an index.
trans-unit.target: 循环语句用于一次（或多次）执行代码块。将 .each 添加到定义数组或哈希的表达式时，将创建循环语句。数组是对象的整数索引集合。数组中的每个元素都可以与索引关联并由索引引用。

trans-unit.source: A metadata.json file can be edited directly, should temporary changes be required. Any subsequent upload or action that generates metadata will cause the existing metadata.json file to be overwritten with the newly generated metadata. Therefore, any permanent changes to cookbook metadata should be done in the metadata.rb file, and then re-uploaded to the Chef Infra Server.
trans-unit.target: 元数据.json文件可以直接编辑,如果需要临时更改。任何后续的上传或生成元数据的操作都会导致现有的metadata.json文件被新生成的元数据覆盖。因此,对食谱元数据的任何永久性更改都应该在metadata.rb文件中进行,然后重新上传至Chef Infra服务器。

trans-unit.source: A multiplier applied to the group’s maximum servicing capacity (based on UTILIZATION, RATE or CONNECTION). Default value is 1, which means the group will serve up to 100% of its configured capacity (depending on balancingMode). A setting of 0 means the group is completely drained, offering 0% of its available Capacity. Valid range is [0.0,1.0].
trans-unit.target: 乘数应用于组的最大服务容量（基于“利用率”，“费率”或“连接”）。默认值为1，这表示该组最多可使用其配置容量的100％（取决于balanceMode）。设置为0表示该组已完全耗尽，提供其可用容量的0％。有效范围是[0.0,1.0]。

trans-unit.source: A multiplier applied to the group’s maximum servicing capacity (based on UTILIZATION, RATE or CONNECTION). ~>NOTE: This field cannot be set for INTERNAL region backend services (default loadBalancingScheme), but is required for non-INTERNAL backend service. The total capacity_scaler for all backends must be non-zero. A setting of 0 means the group is completely drained, offering 0% of its available Capacity. Valid range is [0.0,1.0].
trans-unit.target: 乘数应用于组的最大服务容量（基于“利用率”，“费率”或“连接”）。〜>注：不能为内部区域后端服务（默认loadBalancingScheme）设置此字段，但对于非内部后端服务是必需的。所有后端的total_scaler必须不为零。设置为0表示该组已完全耗尽，提供其可用容量的0％。有效范围是[0.0,1.0]。

trans-unit.source: A named port on a backend instance group representing the port for communication to the backend VMs in that group. Required when the loadBalancingScheme is EXTERNAL, INTERNAL_MANAGED, or INTERNAL_SELF_MANAGED and the backends are instance groups. The named port must be defined on each backend instance group. This parameter has no meaning if the backends are NEGs. API sets a default of “http” if not given. Must be omitted when the loadBalancingScheme is INTERNAL (Internal TCP/UDP Load Balancing).
trans-unit.target: 后端实例组上的命名端口，表示用于与该组中的后端VM通信的端口。当loadBalancingScheme为EXTERNAL，INTERNAL_MANAGED或INTERNAL_SELF_MANAGED且后端为实例组时，则为必需。必须在每个后端实例组上定义命名的端口。如果后端是NEG，则此参数没有意义。如果未提供，API会将默认设置为“ http”。当loadBalancingScheme为INTERNAL（内部TCP / UDP负载平衡）时，必须省略。

Selecting the Waived status filter displays the respective Node or Profile reporting with the waived status. Hover over the control’s Waived icon under the Node Status column in Controls to view more details about the waiver applied to the control.

At this point, no other build or run dependencies have been resolved so the code in this function can only rely on what the build program provides or software pulled in via the Scaffolding’s Plan.

trans-unit.target: 一个局部的名字。

trans-unit.source: A partial search query allows a search query to be made against specific attribute keys that are stored on the Chef Infra Server. A partial search query can search the same set of objects on the Chef Infra Server as a full search query, including specifying an object index and providing a query that can be matched to the relevant index. While a full search query will return an array of objects that match (each object containing a full set of attributes for the node), a partial search query will return only the values for the attributes that match. One primary benefit of using a partial search query is that it requires less memory and network bandwidth while Chef Infra Client processes the search results. The attributes to be returned by the partial search are specified in the request JSON body.
trans-unit.target: 部分搜索查询可以针对存储在Chef Infra服务器上的特定属性键进行搜索查询。部分搜索查询可以在Chef Infra服务器上搜索与完整搜索查询相同的对象集,包括指定对象索引并提供可与相关索引匹配的查询。完全搜索查询将返回匹配的对象数组(每个对象包含节点的全套属性),而部分搜索查询将只返回匹配的属性值。使用部分搜索查询的一个主要好处是,当Chef Infra Client处理搜索结果时,它需要较少的内存和网络带宽。部分搜索要返回的属性在请求JSON体中指定。

trans-unit.source: A partial search query allows a search query to be made against specific attribute keys that are stored on the Chef server. A partial search query can search the same set of objects on the Chef server as a full search query, including specifying an object index and providing a query that can be matched to the relevant index. While a full search query will return an array of objects that match (each object containing a full set of attributes for the node), a partial search query will return only the values for the attributes that match. One primary benefit of using a partial search query is that it requires less memory and network bandwidth while the chef-client processes the search results.
trans-unit.target: 部分搜索查询可以针对存储在Chef服务器上的特定属性键进行搜索查询。部分搜索查询可以在Chef服务器上搜索与完整搜索查询相同的对象集,包括指定一个对象索引,并提供一个可以与相关索引匹配的查询。全搜索查询将返回匹配的对象数组(每个对象都包含节点的完整属性集),而部分搜索查询将只返回匹配的属性值。使用部分搜索查询的一个主要好处是,当厨师客户端处理搜索结果时,它需要较少的内存和网络带宽。

trans-unit.source: A path to a directory in the chef-repo against which the ACL is applied. For example: nodes, nodes/*, nodes/my_node, */*, **, roles/base, data/secrets, cookbooks/apache2, /users/*, and so on.
trans-unit.target: 对其应用ACL的Chef-repo中的目录的路径。例如： nodes ， nodes/* ， nodes/my_node ， */* ， ** ， roles/base ， data/secrets ， cookbooks/apache2 ， /users/* 等。

trans-unit.source: A per-environment run-list is a run-list that is associated with a role and a specific environment. More than one environment can be specified in a role, but each specific environment may be associated with only one run-list. If a run-list is not specified, the default run-list will be used. For example:
trans-unit.target: 每环境运行列表是与角色和特定环境相关联的运行列表。在一个角色中可以指定一个以上的环境,但每个特定环境只能与一个运行列表相关联。如果没有指定运行列表,将使用默认的运行列表。比如说,在角色中可以指定多个环境,但每个特定环境只能关联一个运行列表。

trans-unit.source: A pessimistic version constraint is one that will find the upper limit version number within the range specified by the minor version number or patch version number. For example, a pessimistic version constraint for minor version numbers:
trans-unit.target: 悲观的版本约束是指将在次要版本号或补丁版本号指定的范围内找到上限版本号。例如,次要版本号的悲观版本约束。

trans-unit.source: A physical node is typically a server or a virtual machine, but it can be any active device attached to a network that is capable of sending, receiving, and forwarding information over a communications channel. In other words, a physical node is any active device attached to a network that can run a Chef Infra Client and also allow that Chef Infra Client to communicate with a Chef Infra Server.
trans-unit.target: 物理节点通常是服务器或虚拟机,但它也可以是连接到网络上的任何活动设备,能够通过通信通道发送、接收和转发信息。换句话说,物理节点是连接到网络的任何活动设备,它可以运行Chef Infra Client,也可以让Chef Infra Client与Chef Infra Server进行通信。

trans-unit.source: A physical node is typically a server or a virtual machine, but it can be any active device attached to a network that is capable of sending, receiving, and forwarding information over a communications channel. In other words, a physical node is any active device attached to a network that can run a chef-client and also allow that chef-client to communicate with a Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 物理节点通常是服务器或虚拟机,但它也可以是连接到网络上的任何活动设备,能够通过通信通道发送、接收和转发信息。换句话说,物理节点是连接到网络上的任何活动设备,它可以运行一个厨师客户端,并允许该厨师客户端与厨师服务器通信。

trans-unit.source: A piece of data shared with all the members of a ring; examples are election, membership, services, or configuration.
trans-unit.target: 与一个环的所有成员共享的数据,例如选举、会员、服务或配置。

trans-unit.source: A pipeline is series of automated and manual quality gates that take software changes from development to delivery. Pipelines in Workflow have six stages: Verify, Build, Acceptance, Union, Rehearsal, and Delivered.
trans-unit.target: 管道是将软件从开发到交付的一系列自动和手动质量关。工作流中的流水线有六个阶段。验证、构建、验收、联合、排练和交付。

trans-unit.source: A pipeline is series of automated and manual quality gates that take software changes from development to delivery. The goal of a pipeline is to move changes from your workstation into production quickly and safely.
trans-unit.target: 管道是一系列自动和手动的质量门,将软件变更从开发到交付。管道的目标是将变更从工作站快速、安全地转移到生产中。

trans-unit.source: A place to run additional test suites and code analysis tools. Some tests are too time consuming to run in Verify and are better reserved for changes that have received approval.
trans-unit.target: 一个运行附加测试套件和代码分析工具的地方。有些测试在Verify中运行太过耗时,最好保留给已经获得批准的变更。

trans-unit.source: A platform is the operating system or target environment on which a cookbook is to be tested
trans-unit.target: 平台是指要测试一本食谱的操作系统或目标环境。

trans-unit.source: A pointer to a double null-terminated array of null-separated names of services or load ordering groups that the system must start before this service. Specify nil or an empty string if the service has no dependencies. Dependency on a group means that this service can run if at least one member of the group is running after an attempt to start all members of the group.
trans-unit.target: 指向由双引号结尾的，以空值分隔的服务或装入顺序组的名称的双精度数组，系统必须在此服务之前启动该服务或装入顺序组。如果服务没有依赖关系，请指定 nil 或一个空字符串。对组的依赖性意味着，在尝试启动该组的所有成员之后，如果该组的至少一个成员正在运行，则该服务可以运行。

trans-unit.source: A policy group defines a set of hosts in a deployed units, typically mapped to organizational requirements such as “dev”, “test”, “staging”, and “production”, but can also be mapped to more detailed requirements as needed
trans-unit.target: 策略组在已部署的单元中定义了一组主机，这些主机通常映射到组织需求，例如“开发”，“测试”，“分段”和“生产”，但也可以根据需要映射到更详细的需求

trans-unit.source: A policy is typically named after the functional role ahost performs, such as “application server”, “chat server”, “load balancer”, and so on
trans-unit.target: 通常以主机执行的功能角色（例如“应用程序服务器”，“聊天服务器”，“负载平衡器”等）命名策略。

trans-unit.source: A policy statement must include a Role, or a list of inline Actions.
trans-unit.target: 策略声明必须包含 Role 或内联 Actions 列表。

trans-unit.source: A policy that specifies the conditions for dead lettering messages in this subscription. If dead_letter_policy is not set, dead lettering is disabled. The Cloud Pub/Sub service account associated with this subscriptions’s parent project (i.e., service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com) must have permission to Acknowledge() messages on this subscription.
trans-unit.target: 一个策略，用于指定此订阅中的无效字母消息的条件。如果未设置dead_letter_policy，则禁用无效字体。与此订阅的父项目关联的Cloud Pub / Sub服务帐户（即service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com）必须具有对此订阅上的Acknowledge（）消息的权限。

trans-unit.source: A policy that specifies the conditions for this subscription’s expiration. A subscription is considered active as long as any connected subscriber is successfully consuming messages from the subscription or is issuing operations on the subscription. If expirationPolicy is not set, a default policy with ttl of 31 days will be used. If it is set but ttl is “”, the resource never expires. The minimum allowed value for expirationPolicy.ttl is 1 day.
trans-unit.target: 一个策略，用于指定此订阅的到期条件。只要任何已连接的订户都成功使用了来自该预订的消息或对该预订进行了发布操作，该预订即被视为活动预订。如果未设置expirationPolicy，则将使用ttl为31天的默认策略。如果已设置但ttl为“”，则资源永不过期。 expirationPolicy.ttl的最小允许值为1天。

trans-unit.source: A prefix for log object names.
trans-unit.target: 日志对象名称的前缀。

trans-unit.target: 在单播TCP/IP和Keepalived上使用VRRP进行主群和备群选举

trans-unit.source: A private Chef Supermarket may be installed on-premise behind the firewall on the internal network. Cookbook retrieval from a private Chef Supermarket is often faster than from the public Chef Supermarket because of closer proximity and fewer cookbooks to resolve. A private Chef Supermarket can also help formalize internal cookbook release management processes (e.g. “a cookbook is not released until it’s published on the private Chef Supermarket”).
trans-unit.target: 私有的Chef Supermarket可能会在内部网络中的防火墙之后本地安装。从私人厨师超级市场检索菜谱通常比从公共厨师超级市场检索菜谱更快，这是因为距离更近并且需要解决的菜谱更少。私人厨师超级市场还可以帮助规范内部食谱发布管理流程（例如，“只有在私人厨师超级市场上发布的食谱才能发布”）。

trans-unit.source: A project cookbook is a cookbook that is located within a project and is used to deploy that project’s software onto one (or more) nodes in the Chef Automate pipeline. These cookbooks are located in the /cookbooks directory, which should exist at the root of the project (similar to the .delivery directory).
trans-unit.target: 项目食谱是位于项目内的食谱，用于将项目的软件部署到Chef Automate管道中的一个（或多个）节点上。这些食谱位于 /cookbooks 目录中，该目录应位于项目的根目录（类似于 .delivery 目录）。

trans-unit.source: A project inside a Chef Automate organization.
trans-unit.target: 一个Chef Automate组织内部的项目。

trans-unit.source: A project may be a binary, a package, or some other set of arbitrary information. The Chef Automate pipeline supports promoting projects through the pipeline using versioned attributes. This is known as a project application. A project application is a useful way to promote projects by using a set of attributes that are pinned to a specific version, and then using those same versioned attributes when deploying software to various stages in the Chef Automate pipeline.
trans-unit.target: 项目可以是一个二进制文件、一个包或其他一些任意信息集。Chef Automate管道支持使用版本属性通过管道推广项目。这就是所谓的项目应用。项目应用是一种有用的方式,通过使用一组被钉在特定版本上的属性来推广项目,然后在将软件部署到Chef Automate管道的各个阶段时使用这些相同的版本属性。

trans-unit.source: A project may use a single cookbook to tell Chef Infra Client how to configure nodes in the Chef Automate pipeline.
trans-unit.target: 一个项目可以使用单一的食谱来告诉Chef Infra Client如何配置Chef Automate管道中的节点。

trans-unit.source: A project may use a single cookbook to tell the Chef Infra Client how to configure nodes in the Chef Automate pipeline.
trans-unit.target: 一个项目可以使用单一的食谱来告诉Chef Infra客户端如何配置Chef Automate管道中的节点。

trans-unit.target: 可以通过在属性上指定 sensitive: true 来将属性标记为敏感。这样可以防止将属性的内容导出到数据收集并发送到Automate服务器。

trans-unit.source: A property can either have a default, or it can be a “name” property (meaning that it will take the value of the resource’s name if not otherwise specified), but not both.
trans-unit.target: 属性可以具有默认值，也可以是“名称”属性（这意味着如果没有另外指定，它将采用资源名称的值），但不能同时使用两者。

trans-unit.source: A property for the gem_package provider that is used to specify a gems binary. By default, the same version of Ruby that is used by the chef-client will be installed.
trans-unit.target: gem_package 提供程序的属性，用于指定gems二进制文件。默认情况下，将安装chef-client使用的相同版本的Ruby。

trans-unit.source: A property from a Desired State Configuration (DSC) resource. Use this property multiple times, one for each property in the Desired State Configuration (DSC) resource. The format for this property must follow property :dsc_property_name, "property_value" for each DSC property added to the resource block.
trans-unit.target: 来自期望状态配置（DSC）资源的属性。多次使用此属性，“期望状态配置（DSC）”资源中的每个属性使用一次。对于添加到资源块的每个DSC属性，此属性的格式必须遵循 property :dsc_property_name, "property_value" 。

trans-unit.source: A provider that is used to create custom service providers by defining the custom provider as a sub-class of this provider. This provider should not be used in recipes as a value of the provider attribute.
trans-unit.target: 通过将定制提供程序定义为该提供程序的子类来创建定制服务提供程序的提供程序。此提供程序不应在配方中用作 provider 属性的值。

trans-unit.source: A provisioner is the component on which the Chef Infra Client code will be run, either using chef-zero or chef-solo via the chef_zero and chef_solo provisioners, respectively
trans-unit.target: chef_zero chef_solo 是将在其上运行Chef Infra Client代码的组件，分别通过Chef_zero和Chef_solo预配器使用Chef-zero或Chef-solo

trans-unit.source: A question mark ("?") can be used to replace exactly one character (as long as that character is not the first character)

trans-unit.target: 要执行的带引号（“”）的代码字符串。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the directory already exists, the existing mode on the directory is used. If mode is not specified, the directory does not exist, and the :create action is specified, Chef Infra Client assumes a mask value of '0777', and then applies the umask for the system on which the directory is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', Chef Infra Client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5个字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且目录已存在，则使用目录上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则目录不存在，并且指定了 :create 操作，Chef Infra Client假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建目录的系统的umask应用于 mask 值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef Infra Client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the directory already exists, the existing mode on the directory is used. If mode is not specified, the directory does not exist, and the :create action is specified, the chef-client assumes a mask value of '0777', and then applies the umask for the system on which the directory is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', the chef-client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5个字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且目录已存在，则使用目录上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则目录不存在，并且指定了 :create 操作，chef-client假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建目录的系统的umask应用于该 mask 值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef-client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the file already exists, the existing mode on the file is used. If mode is not specified, the file does not exist, and the :create action is specified, Chef Infra Client assumes a mask value of '0777' and then applies the umask for the system on which the file is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', Chef Infra Client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且文件已存在，则使用文件上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则文件不存在，并且指定了 :create 操作，Chef Infra Client假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建文件的系统的umask应用于 mask 价值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef Infra Client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the file already exists, the existing mode on the file is used. If mode is not specified, the file does not exist, and the :create action is specified, the chef-client assumes a mask value of '0777' and then applies the umask for the system on which the file is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', the chef-client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5个字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且文件已存在，则使用文件上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则文件不存在，并且指定了 :create 动作，则厨师客户端假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建文件的系统的umask应用于 mask 值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef-client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A random number between zero and splay that is added to interval. trans-unit.source: A resource can also be defined in /libraries directory. Some advantages of this approach include more control over how resources behave in the provider, the ability to control the name of the resource directly, and more options available for writing tests. The resources and providers for a library resource, similar to lightweight resources (defined in the /resources and /providers folders) typically have a separate file for the resource and the provider, but this is not requirement. The main disadvantage of this approach is that resources defined in the /libraries directory may not use the Recipe DSL.

trans-unit.source: A role is a named list of actions. This list provides the benefit of encapsulation. A policy statement needs only the role’s name, and the policy is not burdened by all the details. Also, the list offers reusability as you can apply the role to any statement that needs it.
trans-unit.target: 角色是动作的命名列表。此列表提供了封装的好处。策略声明仅需要角色的名称，并且策略不会受到所有详细信息的负担。此外，该列表还提供了可重用性，因为您可以将该角色应用于需要它的任何语句。

trans-unit.source: A role is a way to define certain patterns and processes that exist across nodes in an organization as belonging to a single job function.
trans-unit.target: 角色是一种定义组织中跨节点存在的某些模式和流程属于单一工作职能的方式。

trans-unit.source: A role is a way to define certain patterns and processes that exist across nodes in an organization as belonging to a single job function. Each role consists of zero (or more) attributes and a run-list. Each node can have zero (or more) roles assigned to it. When a role is run against a node, the configuration details of that node are compared against the attributes of the role, and then the contents of that role’s run-list are applied to the node’s configuration details. When a Chef Infra Client runs, it merges its own attributes and run-lists with those contained within each assigned role.
trans-unit.target: 角色是一种将组织中各个节点之间存在的某些模式和流程定义为属于单个作业功能的一种方式。每个角色都包含零个（或更多）属性和一个运行列表。每个节点可以分配有零个（或更多）角色。当针对某个节点运行角色时，会将该节点的配置详细信息与角色的属性进行比较，然后将该角色的运行列表的内容应用于该节点的配置详细信息。 Chef Infra Client运行时，会将其自己的属性和运行列表与每个分配的角色中包含的属性和运行列表合并。

trans-unit.source: A role is a way to define certain patterns and processes that exist across nodes in an organization as belonging to a single job function. When a role is run against a node, the configuration details of that node are compared against the attributes of the role, and then the contents of that role’s run-list are applied to the node’s configuration details. When a chef-client runs, it merges its own attributes and run-lists with those contained within each assigned role.

trans-unit.source: A run-time dependency in Chef Automate is defined as an API-level dependency between two distinct pieces of software that occurs after both pieces have already compiled and started running. This type of dependency is distinct from compile-time dependencies, which should be handled through other means, such as local build verification tests and through the publish phase. Dependencies are tracked in Chef Automate because it is not safe to deploy a project in an inter-dependent test environment if other related projects are failing.
trans-unit.target: Chef Automate 中的运行时依赖性被定义为两个不同软件之间的 API 级依赖性,发生在两个软件都已经编译并开始运行之后。这种类型的依赖与编译时依赖不同,编译时依赖应通过其他方式处理,如本地构建验证测试和发布阶段。在Chef Automate中跟踪依赖关系,因为如果其他相关项目失败,在相互依赖的测试环境中部署项目是不安全的。

trans-unit.source: A service can be optionally bind to a service to unlock additional features. For example, say you have an application that may run with or without a caching layer. You can model this using an optional bind named (say), “cache”. If you wish to run without the caching functionality enabled, you can start the service without specifying a service group mapping for the “cache” bind. Since the bind is optional, it is not needed for Chef Habitat to run your service. However, if you do wish to run with the caching enabled, you can specify a service group mapping, e.g. hab svc load acme/my-app --bind=cache:redis.prod. In this scenario, your service’s configuration can pull configuration values from the redis.prod service group, enabling it to use Redis as a caching layer.
trans-unit.target: 可以选择将服务绑定到服务以解锁其他功能。例如，假设您有一个可以在有或没有缓存层的情况下运行的应用程序。您可以使用名为（例如）“缓存”的可选绑定对此进行建模。如果希望在未启用缓存功能的情况下运行，则可以在不为“缓存”绑定指定服务组映射的情况下启动服务。由于绑定是可选的，因此厨师居所不需要运行服务。但是，如果您希望在启用缓存的情况下运行，则可以指定服务组映射，例如 hab svc load acme/my-app --bind=cache:redis.prod 。在这种情况下，服务的配置可以从 redis.prod 服务组中提取配置值，从而使其可以将Redis用作缓存层。

trans-unit.source: A service group contains all of the services for a single package. The services in a group share a single relationship structure (topology) and are connected within a Chef Habitat supervisor network.
trans-unit.target: 一个服务组包含一个包的所有服务。组中的服务共享一个单一的关系结构(拓扑结构),并在一个Chef Habitat主管网络中连接。

trans-unit.source: A service group is a logical grouping of services with the same package and topology type connected together across a Supervisor network. They are created to share configuration and file updates among the services within those groups and can be segmented based on workflow or deployment needs (QA, Production, and so on). Updates can also be encrypted so that only members of a specific service group can decrypt the contents.
trans-unit.target: 服务组是具有相同包和拓扑类型的服务的逻辑分组，这些服务通过Supervisor网络连接在一起。创建它们是为了在这些组内的服务之间共享配置和文件更新，并且可以根据工作流或部署需求（QA，生产等）进行细分。更新也可以被加密，以便只有特定服务组的成员才能解密内容。

trans-unit.source: A service group is a set of one or more running services with a shared configuration and topology. If a service is started without explicitly naming the group, it is assigned to the default group for the name of that package. For example:

trans-unit.source: A service may can optionally bind one of several services; if bind “X” is mapped, operate this way; if “Y” is mapped, operate that way. An application that could use either a Redis backend or a PostgreSQL backend, depending on the deployment scenario, could declare optional “redis” and “postgresql” bindings, and pick which one to map at service load-time. If this is your use case, Chef Habitat does not have a way to encode the fact that “one and only one of these optional bindings should be mapped”, so you will have to manage that on your own.
trans-unit.target: 一个服务可以选择绑定几个服务之一。如果绑定“ X”被映射，则以这种方式操作；如果映射了“ Y”，则以这种方式操作。根据部署方案的不同，可以使用Redis后端或PostgreSQL后端的应用程序可以声明可选的“ redis”和“ postgresql”绑定，并选择在服务加载时映射哪个绑定。如果这是您的用例，Chef Habitat将无法编码“应该映射这些可选绑定中的一个且只有其中一个”这一事实，因此您将不得不自己进行管理。

trans-unit.source: A service may have some default functionality which may be overridden at load-time by mapping an optional binding. Perhaps you have some kind of artifact repository service that, in the absence of a “remote-store” bind stores data on the local filesystem. However, if remote-store is bound to an appropriate S3 API-compatible service, such as Minio, it could modify its behavior to store data remotely.
trans-unit.target: 服务可能具有一些默认功能，这些功能可以在加载时通​​过映射可选绑定而被覆盖。也许您有某种工件存储库服务，在没有“远程存储”绑定的情况下，它会将数据存储在本地文件系统上。但是，如果将 remote-store 绑定到适当的S3 API兼容服务（例如Minio），则它可以修改其行为以远程存储数据。

trans-unit.source: A single loopback interface should be configured using the 127.0.0.1 address. All ports should be accessible through the loopback interface of their respective hosts.

trans-unit.source: A summary of updates is printed at the end of a Chef Infra Client run. A dot (.) is printed for events that do not have meaningful status information, such as loading a file or synchronizing a cookbook. For resources, a dot (.) is printed when the resource is up to date, an S is printed when the resource is skipped by not_if or only_if, and a U is printed when the resource is updated.
trans-unit.target: 在Chef Infra Client运行结束时，将打印更新摘要。对于没有有意义的状态信息的事件（例如，加载文件或同步菜谱），将打印点（ . ）。对于资源，当资源为最新时，将打印一个点（ . ），当资源被 not_if 或 only_if 跳过时，将打印一个 S ，而当资源被更新时，一个 U 将被打印。

trans-unit.source: A summary of updates is printed at the end of the chef-client run. A dot (.) is printed for events that do not have meaningful status information, such as loading a file or synchronizing a cookbook. For resources, a dot (.) is printed when the resource is up to date, an S is printed when the resource is skipped by not_if or only_if, and a U is printed when the resource is updated.
trans-unit.target: 在chef-client运行结束时，将打印更新摘要。对于没有有意义的状态信息的事件（例如，加载文件或同步菜谱），将打印点（ . ）。对于资源，当资源为最新时，将打印一个点（ . ），当资源被 not_if 或 only_if 跳过时，将打印一个 S ，而当资源被更新时，一个 U 将被打印。

trans-unit.source: A symbol that specifies the type of package. Possible values: :custom (such as installing a non-.msi file that embeds an .msi-based installer), :inno (Inno Setup), :installshield (InstallShield), :msi (Microsoft Installer Package (MSI)), :nsis (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System (NSIS)), :wise (Wise).
trans-unit.target: 指定包装类型的符号。可能的值： :custom （如安装嵌入基于的.msi的安装程序非.msi文件） :inno （Inno Setup的） :installshield （InstallShield将） :msi （Microsoft安装程序包（MSI）） :nsis （Nullsoft脚本安装系统（NSIS）），: :wise （明智）。

trans-unit.source: A symbolic description of how CloudWatch Logs should interpret the data in each log event. For example, a log event may contain timestamps, IP addresses, strings, and so on. You use the filter pattern to specify what to look for in the log event message.
trans-unit.target: 关于 CloudWatch 日志应如何解释每个日志事件中的数据的符号描述。例如,日志事件可能包含时间戳、IP 地址、字符串等。您可以使用过滤器模式来指定日志事件消息中要查找的内容。

trans-unit.source: A symbolic link—sometimes referred to as a soft link—is a directory entry that associates a file name with a string that contains an absolute or relative path to a file on any file system. In other words, “a file that contains a path that points to another file.” A symbolic link creates a new file with a new inode that points to the inode location of the original file.
trans-unit.target: 符号链接（有时称为软链接）是目录条目，它将文件名与包含任何文件系统上文件的绝对或相对路径的字符串相关联。换句话说，“一个文件包含指向另一个文件的路径。” 符号链接将创建一个新文件，该文件具有指向原始文件的inode位置的新inode。

trans-unit.source: A symlink of unzip which points to the BusyBox binary and used by the build program to extract zipped source archives. This is copied in to the tarball as /tools/bin/unzip -> busybox.
trans-unit.target: unzip 的符号链接，指向BusyBox二进制文件，构建程序使用该符号链接提取压缩的源归档文件。它以 /tools/bin/unzip -> busybox 形式复制到tarball中。

trans-unit.source: A system can have multiple versions of the same-named package installed (or even multiple releases of the same version of the same named package). For this reason, if you under-specify the resource parameters, you may match with multiple packages. Under these conditions, this resource will throw an ArgumentError exception, and the resource test will be recorded as a failure.
trans-unit.target: 系统可以安装具有相同名称的软件包的多个版本（甚至可以包含具有相同名称的软件包的相同版本的多个版本）。因此，如果您未指定资源参数，则可能与多个软件包匹配。在这种情况下，此资源将引发 ArgumentError 异常，并且该资源测试将记录为失败。

trans-unit.source: A tag is a custom description that is applied to a node. A tag, once applied, can be helpful when managing nodes using knife or when building recipes by providing alternate methods of grouping similar types of information.

trans-unit.source: A tautology, when used as a description for a component, setting, method, etc. should be avoided. If a string is a tautology, some effort should be made to make it not so. An example of a tautology is something like “Create a new user” (by its very nature, a user created is a new user) or (for a setting named cidr_block) “The CIDR block for the VPC.”

trans-unit.source: A valueExtractor is required when using a distribution logs-based metric to extract the values to record from a log entry. Two functions are supported for value extraction - EXTRACT(field) or REGEXP_EXTRACT(field, regex). The argument are 1. field - The name of the log entry field from which the value is to be extracted. 2. regex - A regular expression using the Google RE2 syntax (https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax) with a single capture group to extract data from the specified log entry field. The value of the field is converted to a string before applying the regex. It is an error to specify a regex that does not include exactly one capture group.
trans-unit.target: 使用基于分发日志的度量标准从日志条目中提取要记录的值时，需要valueExtractor。支持两个函数进行值提取-EXTRACT（field）或REGEXP_EXTRACT（field，regex）。参数为1。field-要从中提取值的日志输入字段的名称。 2.正则表达式-使用Google RE2语法（https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax）的正则表达式，具有单个捕获组，可从指定的日志输入字段中提取数据。在应用正则表达式之前，该字段的值将转换为字符串。指定不完全包含一个捕获组的正则表达式是错误的。

trans-unit.source: A work triangle is in play in Chef Desktop. The first leg is the Chef Automate with Chef Infra Server that holds and applies configurations to your nodes. The second leg is your administrator’s development environment, which runs Chef Workstation, where you will create and define the policies and settings that the Chef Infra Server metes out. The third leg of the triangle is the list of devices, or “nodes”, to which you apply the polices and settings.
trans-unit.target: Chef桌面中正在工作的三角形。第一站是“ Chef Automate with Chef Infra Server”，它拥有配置并将其应用于节点。第二步是管理员的开发环境，该环境运行Chef Workstation，您将在其中创建和定义Chef Infra Server满足的策略和设置。三角形的第三行是应用策略和设置的设备或“节点”的列表。

trans-unit.source: A work triangle is in play in Chef Desktop. The first leg is the Chef Infra Server with Chef Automate that holds and applies configurations to your nodes. The second leg is a Developer node running Chef Workstation from which you create and define the policies and settings that the Chef Infra Server metes out. The third leg of the triangle is the list of nodes to which the various polices and settings are applied.
trans-unit.target: 在Chef Desktop中,有一个工作三角区在发挥作用。第一条腿是带有Chef Automate的Chef Infra Server,它保存并将配置应用到您的节点。第二条腿是运行Chef Workstation的开发者节点,您可以从该节点创建和定义Chef Infra Server执行的策略和设置。三角形的第三条腿是应用各种策略和设置的节点列表。

trans-unit.source: A workflow tool for Chef.
trans-unit.target: 厨师的工作流程工具。

trans-unit.source: A workstation is a computer that is configured to run various Chef command-line tools that synchronize with a chef-repo, author cookbooks, interact with the Chef server, and interact with nodes.
trans-unit.target: 工作站是一台计算机,它被配置为运行各种Chef命令行工具,与chef-repo同步,编写烹饪书,与Chef服务器交互,并与节点交互。

trans-unit.source: A workstation is installed correctly when it is able to use knife to communicate with the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 当一个工作站能够使用刀与Chef服务器通信时,它就被正确安装了。

trans-unit.source: A workstation is used to manage Chef Push Jobs jobs, including maintaining the push-jobs cookbook, using knife to start and stop jobs, view job status, and to manage job lists.
trans-unit.target: 工作站用于管理Chef Push Jobs作业，包括维护Push- Jobs食谱，使用刀具启动和停止作业，查看作业状态以及管理作业列表。

trans-unit.source: A workstation is your local computer running Chef Workstation that you use to author cookbooks, interact with the Chef Infra Server, and interact with nodes.
trans-unit.target: 工作站是您运行Chef Workstation的本地计算机,您使用它来编写烹饪书,与Chef Infra服务器交互,并与节点交互。

trans-unit.source: A wrapper cookbook is used to define project- and/or organization-specific requirements around a community cookbook.
trans-unit.target: 包裹式食谱用于定义项目和/或组织对社区食谱的具体要求。

trans-unit.source: A: For the most part, we leave that up to you. You could just use the aforementioned curl-bash with your provisioner of choice. If your app was dockerized with Chef Habitat then you won’t even need to ask this question, because you’ll have everything you need inside your container. We are working on first class Mesosphere DC/OS, and Cloud Foundry integrations - which you can keep up to date on in our Apache Mesos and DC/OS documentation and blog.
trans-unit.target: 答：在大多数情况下，我们将取决于您。您可以将上述curl-bash与您的预配器一起使用。如果您的应用是由Chef Habitat进行docker化的，那么您甚至不需要问这个问题，因为您将在容器中拥有所需的一切。我们正在致力于一流的Mesosphere DC / OS和Cloud Foundry集成-您可以在我们的Apache Mesos和DC / OS文档和博客中了解最新信息。

trans-unit.source: A: Indeed they are divisive, we know, that’s why we provide a few different ways for you to download. If you’d like to take a look at the script before running it, you can find it in the core Chef Habitat repo.
trans-unit.target: 答：我们知道它们确实存在分歧，因此我们为您提供了几种不同的下载方式。如果您想在运行脚本之前先看一下脚本，可以在核心Chef Habitat存储库中找到它。

trans-unit.target: 答：我们发布适用于OSX，Linux和Windows的编译包。 hab 要求具有启用Hyper-V的Linux内核> = 2.6.32，OSX> = 10.9或64位Windows 10 Pro，Enterprise或Education版（1511年11月更新，内部版本10586或更高版本）。

trans-unit.target: 答：虽然我们确实在GitHub中削减发行版本，这是发行过程的一部分，但这些归档文件将成为源代码中的 .tar 时间点。由于 hab cli是用Rust编写的，因此如果您采用这种方法，则需要编译平台的源代码。

trans-unit.source: AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) is a managed service that makes it easy for you to create and control the encryption keys used to encrypt your data. AWS KMS lets you create master keys that can never be exported from the service and which can be used to encrypt and decrypt data based on policies you define.
trans-unit.target: AWS 密钥管理服务 (AWS KMS)是一项托管服务,可让您轻松创建和控制用于加密数据的加密密钥。AWS KMS 允许您创建永远无法从服务中导出的主密钥,这些密钥可用于根据您定义的策略对数据进行加密和解密。

trans-unit.source: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) is a managed service that makes creating and controlling your encryption keys for your data easier. KMS uses Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) to protect the security of your keys.
trans-unit.target: AWS 密钥管理服务 (KMS)是一项托管服务,它使您为数据创建和控制加密密钥变得更加容易。KMS 使用硬件安全模块 (HSM)来保护您的密钥的安全性。

trans-unit.source: AWS Key Management Service is integrated with several other AWS services to help you protect the data you store with these services.
trans-unit.target: AWS密钥管理服务与其他一些AWS服务集成在一起,以帮助您保护您在这些服务中存储的数据。

trans-unit.source: Access the initial configuration page by loading /biscotti/setup route. Build the URL by prepending https:// and appending /biscotti/setup to the IP address or public hostname that was automatically assigned to the instance when the Amazon Machine Images (AMI) was launched. For example, https://<fqdn>/biscotti/setup. If you used the BYOL image, the CloudFormation stack will have the setup URL in the Outputs section.
trans-unit.target: 通过加载 /biscotti/setup 路由来访问初始配置页面。通过在 https:// 前面添加https：//，并将 /biscotti/setup 附加到启动Amazon Machine Images（AMI）时自动分配给实例的IP地址或公共主机名来构建URL 。例如， https://<fqdn>/biscotti/setup 。如果您使用BYOL映像，则CloudFormation堆栈将在“ Outputs 部分中具有设置URL 。

trans-unit.source: Actions

trans-unit.source: Actions are policy and administrative changes made to the Chef server. The Chef server gathers a lot of data—–each node object, the node run history for all nodes, the history of every cookbook and cookbook version, how policy settings, such as roles, environments, and data bags, are applied and to what they are applied, individual user data, and so on.
trans-unit.target: 操作是对Chef服务器进行的策略和管理更改。Chef服务器收集大量数据-每个节点对象，所有节点的节点运行历史记录，每个菜谱和菜谱版本的历史记录，如何应用策略设置（例如角色，环境和数据包）以及应用于什么它们被应用，单个用户数据，等等。

trans-unit.source: Actually, the Supervisor does not care what user it is running as; rather, it uses Linux capabilities to guide its behavior. If the process has the CAP_SETUID, CAP_SETGID, and CAP_CHOWN capabilities, it will be able to run processes as the specified pkg_svc_user and pkg_svc_group (CAP_CHOWN is needed to ensure that the service processes can read and write files within the service’s state directories). The Supervisor checks for the presence of these capabilities, and does not rely on having a user ID of 0 or the username root.
trans-unit.target: 实际上，Supervisor并不在乎它以什么用户身份运行；相反，它使用Linux功能来指导其行为。如果该进程具有 CAP_SETUID ， CAP_SETGID 和 CAP_CHOWN 功能，则它将能够以指定的 pkg_svc_user 和 pkg_svc_group 身份运行进程（需要 CAP_CHOWN 以确保服务进程可以在服务的状态目录中读取和写入文件）。主管检查这些功能的存在，并且不依赖于用户ID为0或用户名 root 。
